    Interactive QC panel for Seurat v5 objects

    VisQCPanel.Rd

    Visualize key QC metrics with customizable thresholds and optional interactivity.

    Usage

    VisQCPanel(
  object,
  genes_mt = "^MT-",
  genes_ribo = NULL,
  group.by = NULL,
  interactive = FALSE,
  assay = NULL,
  palette = "C"
)

    Arguments

    object

    A Seurat object.

    genes_mt

    Regex for mitochondrial genes. Default ^MT- for human.

    genes_ribo

    Regex for ribosomal genes (e.g., ^RPL|^RPS).

    group.by

    Column in object@meta.data used for grouping.

    interactive

    If TRUE, returns interactive plots via plotly::ggplotly.

    assay

    Assay to use; defaults to DefaultAssay(object).

    palette

    Viridis palette option.

    Value

    A patchwork assembled ggplot or a list of interactive plots.

    Examples

    obj <- SeuratVisProExample()
#> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck
#> 
#> Number of nodes: 300
#> Number of edges: 11471
#> 
#> Running Louvain algorithm...
#> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8323
#> Number of communities: 3
#> Elapsed time: 0 seconds
p <- VisQCPanel(obj, genes_ribo = "^RPL|^RPS", group.by = "seurat_clusters")
p
